intro: Rondeletia subcanescens, commonly known as the silverleaf rondeletia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its delicate, fragrant flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are typically covered in a fine, silvery pubescence, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions.
